newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia's February export prices rise 1.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Australia's February export prices rise 1.4 pct.

text.p: Australian export prices rose 1.4 percent in February from the previous month and were 4.0 percent lower than a year earlier, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said on Tuesday.
The bureau said the export price index was pushed up in February by higher auction prices for wool and increased prices for aluminium and zinc due to increases in world market prices.
"Partially offsetting these increases were price decreases for wheat and gold," the bureau said.
The index rose to 92.9 in February from 91.6 in January to stand at its highest level since 93.7 in September.
The monthly rise was the second consecutive increase, but only the third rise in the past 13 months.
